meta_description: The Smithsonian American Art Museum is home to one of the largest and most inclusive collections of American art in the world.
hours_text:
# Visit

##  Plan your visit

[](/visit/saam)

SAAM is located at the heart of a vibrant downtown cultural district and presents American art from the colonial period to present.

  * [Plan your visit](/visit/saam/v2)

Smithsonian American Art Museum

8th and G Streets, NW

Washington, DC 20004

Hours

Mon - Sun: 

11:30 am‑7:00 pm  

[](/visit/renwick)

The Renwick Gallery is located near the White House and presents craft and decorative art from the Museum’s collection. 

  * [Plan your visit](/visit/renwick/v2)

Renwick Gallery

Pennsylvania Avenue at 17th Street, NW

Washington, DC 20006

Hours

Mon - Sun: 

10:00 am‑5:30 pm  

We are happy to welcome visitors to the Smithsonian American Art Museum and its Renwick Gallery seven days a week. Visitor guidelines will keep you and the art safe.

When are the Smithsonian American Art Museum and its Renwick Gallery open?

The Smithsonian American Art Museum is open daily from 11:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. The museum is closed Christmas Day, on December 25. The [galleries for 18th to early 20th century art](https://americanart.si.edu/exhibition/18th-20th-century-art) are temporarily closed to the public until Summer 2026.

The Renwick Gallery is open daily from 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. The museum is closed Christmas Day, on December 25.

Do I need tickets to visit the Smithsonian American Art Museum or its Renwick Gallery? 

No, tickets are not required to visit the Smithsonian American Art Museum or its Renwick Gallery. 

Do you have an aud...

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

#### Buildings

Barrier-free access to both SAAM’s main building and its Renwick Gallery are available.

At SAAM, ramps are located on both sides of the 8th and G Streets NW entrance. If you are using MetroAccess Paratransit, please use 800 G Street NW as the address for our building.

At the Renwick Gallery, a ramp at the corner of 17th Street and Pennsylvania Avenue NW leads to an accessible entrance.

All areas of both buildings are served by elevators. Service animals are welcome in both museum buildings.

#### Restrooms

Accessible restrooms are located on all floors of SAAM.

At the Renwick Gallery, accessible restrooms are located on all levels with unisex accessible restrooms on the first floor and basement level.

#### Wheelchair Availability

Manual wheelchairs are available free of charge in the G Street and F Street lobbies at SAAM. Please ask a security guard.

The Renwick Gallery offers manual wheelchairs at the basement security desk.

#### SAAM – McEvoy Auditorium 

The Nan Tucker McEvoy Auditorium is accessible by elevator, and contains wheelchair spaces available during performances and lectures. The auditorium is equipped with an induction hearing loop and T-coil infrared assistive listening system.

#### Aira Access

The museum is a location for the Aira Access mobile information and verbal description service. Visitors can download the free Aira app on a smartphone, connect to the museum's free Wi-Fi, and use the app to speak to an Aira a...

November 25, 2025–July 12, 2026

[Smithsonian American Art Museum](/visit/saam )

 _Grandma Moses: A Good Day's Work_ sheds new light on a beloved body of work by the artist. 

[](/exhibitions/state-fairs)

August 22, 2025–September 7, 2026

[Renwick Gallery](/visit/renwick )

 _State Fairs: Growing American Craft_ is the first major exhibition dedicated to artists’ contributions to the great U.S. tradition of state fairs. 

[](/exhibitions/shahzia-sikander-last-post)

July 3, 2025–July 12, 2026

[Smithsonian American Art Museum](/visit/saam )

Shahzia Sikander’s video artwork _The Last Post_ (2010) critically considers the legacy of British colonialism in Asia using her signature approach of infusing Indo-Persian miniature paintings with a contemporary perspective.
